about.text:
At Clarot’s German Shepherds, we strive to produce dogs who embody superior temperament, correct conformation, a keen will to work and above all great health. Our selective breeding program allows you to choose from the finest blood lines Germany has to offer. Our love for the German Shepherd dog started over 30 years ago. I have enjoyed working with my dogs both in the sport of Schutzhund and in the show ring. The ideal German Shepherd dog is a working dog with a reliable character that shows a strong degree of beauty and nobility.

I am among countless people worldwide whose lives are richer for knowing and loving a German Shepherd, the most versatile of dog breeds. The breed was developed to serve man and woman, and also to work for us and with us.

As a breeder, it is my goal to continue producing dogs that are loyal and amazing companions that are able to succeed and adapt to the lifestyle that they are given.

testimonials.text: Thank you for the excellent German shepherd. After having Cassie for half a year, we really want to thank Lino for providing us this excellent dog and his kind support... Lino is such a responsible person. We don’t have experience with dogs at all. Whenever we have any questions, we either message or email Lino and he always responds promptly and gives us a lot of valuable suggestions. Lino is so helpful and supportive. I would recommend Clarot’s German Shepherds to my friends.
testimonials.author: Lucy and family from Richmond Hill

testimonials.text: Our family purchased our puppy from Clarot’s German Shepherds and we have been very pleased with the new addition to our family...I was very pleased with Lino’s knowledge and experience with German Shepherd’s and very thankful as well that any questions I asked he was able to answer. His support both before and after bringing Tasha home has been greatly appreciated. I would definitely recommend Clarot’s German Shepherds to anyone looking for the highest quality in both breeders and German Shepherd’s. Thank you so much Lino!
testimonials.author: The Bowker familyl

testimonials.text: We got Jessie from Clarot almost 2 years ago. She is my 3rd GSD and the most obedient dog I have ever had. Her beauty is stunning! She is also fantastic with chidren, other dogs and people in general. I would highly recommend getting a Clarot Shepherd!
testimonials.author: Kenny Caughlin

testimonials.text: I am pleased to say that we have had our beautiful dog Farrah for over 6 years now. She has an amazing temperament and we are extremely happy with her. We want to thank Lino for his experience and guidance over the years. Farrah is a big part of our family!
testimonials.author: Amanda

testimonials.text: This is the second shepherd we have fallen in love with from Lino. Our first - Sam - enchanted all who knew him. After Sam passed in January 2021, we were grateful to be able to pick up our Jake in July. He is an amazing dog. People in our community are always commenting on the colouring and beauty of our boy(s). And over the years Lino has been there for sharing and for support. Our dog(s) are always with us all day, every day, wherever we go and the devotion and affection we get in return is why we love Lino's shepherds.
testimonials.author: Karen & Rusty

testimonials.text: For me, good temperament is paramount for a family pet and Amara’s temperament is wonderful. I am also impressed with the amount of self confidence she has... The second most important aspect for me is fluent movement. She has a great build and her movement is already quite beautiful. She is flexible, quick and strong. I can’t wait to watch her continue to grow mentally and physically.
testimonials.author: Rachel

faq.title: 1. At what age do you normally let your puppies leave your kennel?
faq.body: All of my puppies are here with me until eight weeks of age. Before they leave they have been dewormed, tattooed, 1st shots, vet checked, and most importantly well socialized.

faq.title: 2. What is the average weight of your males?
faq.body: The average weight is around 90 to 95 pounds.

faq.title: 3. What is the average weight of your females?
faq.body: The average weight is around 70 to 75 pounds.

faq.title: 4. What makes a better pet males or females?
faq.body: German shepherds are very loyal companions. They both make excellent pets. The easiest way to decide is tell the breeder your current situation at home i.e. Do you have other pets? Are they males or females? How much time do you have? Have you had shepherds before? His/her experience can be very helpful when making that decision.

faq.title: 5. Do you breed King German shepherds?
faq.body: No I am sorry I do not. I breed only according to the set standard put in place for us to follow. As a responsible breeder, it is my duty to follow these guidelines for the betterment of the breed. i.e. Health issues/ hip dysplasia. Remember bigger is not better.

faq.title: 6. How much are your puppies?
faq.body: This question varies slightly. Most puppies are sold as pets with a non breeding agreement. The price is variable depending on the breeding that we have done.
